dir=\"auto\"\u003eParse an incoming file upload, with the\n\u003ca href=\"https://nodejs.org/api/http.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eNode.js's built-in \u003ccode\u003ehttp\u003c/code\u003e 'node:http';\nimport formidable, {errors as formidableErrors} from 'formidable';\n\nconst server = http.createServer(async (req, res) =\u0026gt; {\n  if (req.url === '/api/upload' \u0026amp;\u0026amp; req.method.toLowerCase() === 'post') {\n    // parse a file upload\n    const form = formidable({});\n    let fields;\n    let files;\n    try {\n        [fields, files] = await form.parse(req);\n    } catch (err) {\n        // example to check for a very specific error\n        if (err.code === formidableErrors.maxFieldsExceeded) {\n\n        }\n        console.error(err);\n        res.writeHead(err.httpCode || 400, { 'Content-Type': 'text/plain' });\n        res.end(String(err));\n        return;\n    }\n    res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });\n    res.end(JSON.stringify({ fields, files }, null, 2));\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // show a file upload form\n  res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'text/html' });\n  res.end(`\n    \u0026lt;h2\u0026gt;With Node.js \u0026lt;code\u0026gt;\u0026quot;http\u0026quot;\u0026lt;/code\u0026gt; module\u0026lt;/h2\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;form action=\u0026quot;/api/upload\u0026quot; enctype=\u0026quot;multipart/form-data\u0026quot; method=\u0026quot;post\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\n      \u0026lt;div\u0026gt;Text field title: \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;text\u0026quot; name=\u0026quot;title\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/div\u0026gt;\n      \u0026lt;div\u0026gt;File: \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;file\u0026quot; name=\u0026quot;multipleFiles\u0026quot; multiple=\u0026quot;multiple\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/div\u0026gt;\n      \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;submit\u0026quot; value=\u0026quot;Upload\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;/form\u0026gt;\n  `);\n});\n\nserver.listen(8080, () =\u0026gt; {\n  console.log('Server listening on http://localhost:8080/ ...');\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan elegant, but that's for now if you don't want to use `koa-better-body`\n    // or other middlewares.\n    await new Promise((resolve, reject) =\u0026gt; {\n      form.parse(ctx.req, (err, fields, files) =\u0026gt; {\n        if (err) {\n          reject(err);\n          return;\n        }\n\n        ctx.set('Content-Type', 'application/json');\n        ctx.status = 200;\n        ctx.state = { fields, files };\n        ctx.body = JSON.stringify(ctx.state, null, 2);\n        resolve();\n      });\n    });\n    await next();\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // show a file upload form\n  ctx.set('Content-Type', 'text/html');\n  ctx.status = 200;\n  ctx.body = `\n    \u0026lt;h2\u0026gt;With \u0026lt;code\u0026gt;\u0026quot;koa\u0026quot;\u0026lt;/code\u0026gt; npm \u0026lt;div\u0026gt;Text field title: \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;text\u0026quot; name=\u0026quot;title\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/div\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;div\u0026gt;File: \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;file\u0026quot; name=\u0026quot;koaFiles\u0026quot; multiple=\u0026quot;multiple\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/div\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;input type=\u0026quot;submit\u0026quot; value=\u0026quot;Upload\u0026quot; /\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;/form\u0026gt;\n  `;\n});\n\napp.use((ctx) =\u0026gt; {\n  console.log('The next middleware is called');\n  console.log('Results:', allow upload empty\nfiles\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.minFileSize\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003e1\u003c/code\u003e (1byte); the minium size of\nuploaded file.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxFiles\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003eInfinity\u003c/code\u003e;\nlimit the amount of uploaded files, set Infinity for unlimited\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxFileSize\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003e200 * 1024 * 1024\u003c/code\u003e (200mb);\nlimit the size of each uploaded file.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxTotalFileSize\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxFileSize\u003c/code\u003e;\nlimit the size of the batch of uploaded files.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxFields\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003e1000\u003c/code\u003e; limit the number of fields, set Infinity for unlimited\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.maxFieldsSize\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{number}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003e20 * 1024 * 1024\u003c/code\u003e (20mb);\nlimit the amount of memory all fields together (except files) can allocate in\nbytes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.hashAlgorithm\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{string | false}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e; include checksums calculated\nfor incoming files, set this to some hash algorithm, see\n\u003ca href=\"https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html#crypto_crypto_createhash_algorithm_options\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ecrypto.createHash\u003c/a\u003e\nfor available algorithms\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.fileWriteStreamHandler\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{function}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003enull\u003c/code\u003e, which by\ndefault writes to host machine file system every file parsed; The function\nshould return an instance of a\n\u003ca href=\"https://nodejs.org/api/stream.html#stream_class_stream_writable\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eWritable stream\u003c/a\u003e\nthat will receive the uploaded file data. With this option, you can have any\ncustom behavior regarding where the uploaded file data will be streamed for.\nIf you are looking to write the file uploaded in other types of cloud storages\n(AWS S3, Azure blob storage, Google cloud storage) or private file storage,\nthis is the option you're looking for. When this option is defined the default\nbehavior of writing the file in the host machine file system is lost.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.filename\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{function}\u003c/strong\u003e - default \u003ccode\u003eundefined\u003c/code\u003e Use it to control\nnewFilename. Must return a string. Will be joined with options.uploadDir.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoptions.filter\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e{function}\u003c/strong\u003e - default function that always returns true.\nUse it to filter files before they are uploaded. Must return a boolean. By default we include\n4 plugins, which essentially are adapters to plug the different built-in parsers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe plugins added by this method are always enabled.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee \u003ca href=\"/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/plugins\"\u003esrc/plugins/\u003c/a\u003e for more detailed look on default plugins.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eplugin\u003c/code\u003e param has such signature:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"function(formidable: Formidable, options: Options): void;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efunction\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eformidable\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eFormidable\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eoptions\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eOptions\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003evoid\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe architecture is simple. The \u003ccode\u003eplugin\u003c/code\u003e is a function that is passed with the\nFormidable instance (the \u003ccode\u003eform\u003c/code\u003e across the README examples) and the options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNote:\u003c/strong\u003e the plugin function's \u003ccode\u003ethis\u003c/code\u003e context is also the same instance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"const form = formidable({ keepExtensions: true });\n\nform.use((self, options) =\u0026gt; {\n  // self === this === form\n  console.log('woohoo, custom plugin');\n  // do your stuff; check `src/plugins` for inspiration\n});\n\nform.parse(req, (error, fields, files) =\u0026gt; {\n  console.log('done!');\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003econst\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eform\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eformidable\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ekeepExtensions\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etrue\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eform\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003euse\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eoptions\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// self === this === form\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003econsole\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003elog\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'woohoo, custom plugin'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// do your stuff; check `src/plugins` for inspiration\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eform\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eparse\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ereq\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eerror\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003efields\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003efiles\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003econsole\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003elog\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'done!'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eImportant to note\u003c/strong\u003e, is that inside plugin \u003ccode\u003ethis.options\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eself.options\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eoptions\u003c/code\u003e MAY or MAY NOT be the same. General best practice is to always use the\n\u003ccode\u003ethis\u003c/code\u003e, so you can later test your plugin independently and more easily.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you want to disable some parsing capabilities of Formidable, you can disable\nthe plugin which corresponds to the parser. For example, if you want to disable\nmultipart parsing (so the \u003ca href=\"/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/parsers/Multipart.js\"\u003esrc/parsers/Multipart.js\u003c/a\u003e\nwhich is module was initially developed by<a href="https://github.com/felixge"><strong>@felixge</strong></a> for<a href="http://transloadit.com/" rel="nofollow">Transloadit</a>, a service focused on uploading andencoding images and videos. It has been battle-tested against hundreds of GBs offile uploads from a large variety of clients and is considered production-readyand is used in production for years.</p><p dir="auto">Currently, we are few maintainers trying to deal with it. :) More contributorsare always welcome! ❤️ Jump on<a href="https://github.com/felixge/node-formidable/issues/412" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/node-formidable/formidable/issues/412/hovercard">issue #412</a> which isclosed, but if you are interested we can discuss it and add you after strictrules, like enabling Two-Factor Auth in your npm and GitHub accounts.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Highlights</h2><a id="user-content-highlights" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Highlights" href="#highlights"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="#benchmarks">Fast (~900-2500 mb/sec)</a> & streaming multipart parser</li><li>Automatically writing file uploads to disk (optional, see<a href="#options"><code>options.fileWriteStreamHandler</code></a>)</li><li><a href="#useplugin-plugin">Plugins API</a> - allowing custom parsers and plugins</li><li>Low memory footprint</li><li>Graceful error handling</li><li>Very high test coverage</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Install</h2><a id="user-content-install" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Install" href="#install"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This package is a dual ESM/commonjs package.</p><p dir="auto">This project requires <code>Node.js >= 10.13</code>. <code>DEFAULT_OPTIONS</code> constant).</p><ul dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.encoding</code> <strong>{string}</strong> - default <code>'utf-8'</code>; sets encoding forincoming form fields,</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.uploadDir</code> <strong>{string}</strong> - default <code>os.tmpdir()</code>; the directory forplacing file uploads in. You can move them later by using <code>fs.rename()</code>.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.keepExtensions</code> <strong>{boolean}</strong> - default <code>false</code>; to include theextensions of the original files or not</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.allowEmptyFiles</code> <strong>{boolean}</strong> - default <code>false</code>; allow upload emptyfiles</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.minFileSize</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>1</code> (1byte); the minium size ofuploaded file.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.maxFiles</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>Infinity</code>;limit the amount of uploaded files, set Infinity for unlimited</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.maxFileSize</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>200 * 1024 * 1024</code> (200mb);limit the size of each uploaded file.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.maxTotalFileSize</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>options.maxFileSize</code>;limit the size of the batch of uploaded files.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.maxFields</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>1000</code>; limit the number of fields, set Infinity for unlimited</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.maxFieldsSize</code> <strong>{number}</strong> - default <code>20 * 1024 * 1024</code> (20mb);limit the amount of memory all fields together (except files) can allocate inbytes.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.hashAlgorithm</code> <strong>{string | false}</strong> - default <code>false</code>; include checksums calculatedfor incoming files, set this to some hash algorithm, see<a href="https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html#crypto_crypto_createhash_algorithm_options" rel="nofollow">crypto.createHash</a>for available algorithms</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.fileWriteStreamHandler</code> <strong>{function}</strong> - default <code>null</code>, which bydefault writes to host machine file system every file parsed; The functionshould return an instance of a<a href="https://nodejs.org/api/stream.html#stream_class_stream_writable" rel="nofollow">Writable stream</a>that will receive the uploaded file data. With this option, you can have anycustom behavior regarding where the uploaded file data will be streamed for.If you are looking to write the file uploaded in other types of cloud storages(AWS S3, Azure blob storage, Google cloud storage) or private file storage,this is the option you're looking for. When this option is defined the defaultbehavior of writing the file in the host machine file system is lost.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.filename</code> <strong>{function}</strong> - default <code>undefined</code> Use it to controlnewFilename. Must return a string. Will be joined with options.uploadDir.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.filter</code> <strong>{function}</strong> - default function that always returns true.Use it to filter files before they are uploaded. Must return a boolean. Will not make the form.parse error</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><code>options.createDirsFromUploads</code> <strong>{boolean}</strong> - default false. If true, makes direct folder uploads possible. Use <code><input type="file" name="folders" webkitdirectory directory multiple></code> to create a form to upload folders. Has to be used with the options <code>options.uploadDir</code> and <code>options.filename</code> where <code>options.filename</code> has to return a string with the character <code>/</code> for folders to be created. The base will be <code>options.uploadDir</code>.</p></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>options.filename</code> 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A method that allows you to extend the Formidable library. By default we include4 plugins, which essentially are adapters to plug the different built-in parsers.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>The plugins added by this method are always enabled.</strong></p><p dir="auto"><em>See <a href="/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/plugins">src/plugins/</a> for more detailed look on default plugins.</em></p><p dir="auto">The <code>plugin</code> param has such signature:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="function(formidable: Formidable, options: Options): void;"><pre><span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">formidable</span>: <span class="pl-smi">Formidable</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span>: <span class="pl-smi">Options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>: <span class="pl-smi"><span class="pl-k">void</span></span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The architecture is simple. The <code>plugin</code> is a function that is passed with theFormidable instance (the <code>form</code> across the README examples) and the options.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>Note:</strong> the plugin function's <code>this</code> context is also the same instance.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const form = formidable({ keepExtensions: true });form.use((self, options) => {  // self === this === form  console.log('woohoo, custom plugin');  // do your stuff; check `src/plugins` for inspiration});form.parse(req, (error, fields, files) => {  console.log('done!');});"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">form</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">formidable</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">keepExtensions</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-s1">form</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">use</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">self</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c">// self === this === form</span>  <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'woohoo, custom plugin'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>  <span class="pl-c">// do your stuff; check `src/plugins` for inspiration</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-s1">form</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">parse</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">req</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">error</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">fields</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">files</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'done!'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Important to note</strong>, is that inside plugin <code>this.options</code>, <code>self.options</code> and<code>options</code> MAY or MAY NOT be the same. General best practice is to always use the<code>this</code>, so you can later test your plugin independently and more easily.</p><p dir="auto">If you want to disable some parsing capabilities of Formidable, you can disablethe plugin which corresponds to the parser. For example, if you want to disablemultipart parsing (so the <a href="/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/parsers/Multipart.js">src/parsers/Multipart.js</a>which is used in <a href="/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/plugins/multipart.js">src/plugins/multipart.js</a>), thenyou can remove it from the <code>options.enabledPlugins</code>, like so</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import formidable, {octetstream, querystring, json} from "formidable";const form = formidable({  hashAlgorithm: 'sha1',  enabledPlugins: [octetstream, querystring, json],});"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">formidable</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-s1">octetstream</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">querystring</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">json</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">"formidable"</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">form</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">formidable</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">hashAlgorithm</span>: <span class="pl-s">'sha1'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">enabledPlugins</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">octetstream</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">querystring</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">json</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Be aware</strong> that the order <em>MAY</em> be important too. The names corresponds 1:1 tofiles in <a href="/node-formidable/formidable/blob/master/src/plugins">src/plugins/</a> folder.</p><p dir="auto">Pull requests for new built-in plugins MAY be accepted - for example, moreadvanced querystring parser.
